titles.title: A bill to designate high priority corridors on the National Highway System, and for other purposes.
A bill to designate high priority corridors on the National Highway System, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

bill.summary:
This bill expands and designates high priority corridors on the National Highway System.
Specifically, the bill
designates the Central Louisiana Corridor, the Central Mississippi Corridor, the Middle Alabama Corridor, and the Middle Georgia Corridor as high priority corridors on the system; and expands Interstate Route I-14 within the Central Texas Corridor, the Central Louisiana Corridor, the Central Mississippi Corridor, the Middle Alabama Corridor, and the Middle Georgia Corridor.
